immune.note: from  nonmagical  weapons  that  aren't  silvered

trait.name: Trapped Shapechanger
entries: The failed storm conduit werewolf cannot use its action to polymorph back into its true form, which is humanoid. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The failed storm conduit werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks  that rely  on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Reckless Overcharge (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The failed storm conduit werewolf infuses itself with electric energy that he can't control. While this effect is active, for 1 minute, it can use a bonus action on each of its turn to teleport up to 10ft. In addition the first creature that damages it with a Melee Attack during the round takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) lightning damage and it takes half of that damage, as the electricity jolts.
Right after the effect ends, it takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn, as the electricity escapes its body.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The  failed  storm  conduit  werewolf  makes  two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take an additional 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

A monstrous scream rattles the facility. ‘Another Failure" mumbles the doctor, standing above the body of the werewolf, that just rejected the transplant. He turns towards one of the large glass tube holding his only success. "Why are you gathering all this lightning when the others can't..." The massive monster made of fur and steel, with electricity coursing through it and the device on its back, grins,.., before vanishing. The assistant watches in horror as a claw pierces through the chest of his mentor. The beast is free.

Storm Conduits are werewolves that have been experimented on. During times of war, governments wanted to create a more powerful militia. Werewolves due to their unique genetic lineup were the perfect test subject. They were hunted and captured. Cruel experiments lead to many failures, and a few success, creatures capable of vanishing, and striking like the lightning. Losing their humanity in the process.

entries.name: Freedom at any cost
entries: Storm conduits were captured, and the few that managed to escape swore to never be treated like a lab animal again. They will fight for their freedom, and the freedom of their own until the bitter end, using any amounts of dirty tactics to achieve their goal.

entries.name: Trapped in flesh
entries: Storm Conduits used to be able to revert back to their human form, but the experiments removed that ability from them. Shunning them forever from societies. They live in the far outskirts of civilisation, in small tribes.

entries.name: Doomed to death
entries: Storm conduit lost their freedom and their ability to transform in the experiments, but also their ability to reproduce. The tribes that live together know that they will all perish, even if a few of them are still looking around for a method to remove the device implanted in their body.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Overcharge (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The storm conduit werewolf infuses itself with electric energy. While this effect is active, for 1 minute, it can use a bonus action on each of its turn to teleport up to 15ft, it has resistance against lightning and thunder damage. In addition when a creature within 5ft of it damages it, it can use its reaction to make a Claw Attack against that creature.
Right after the effect ends, it takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn, as the electricity escapes its body.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The Umbral Skullbearer can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 ft of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically t, respond.

trait.name: Snuff Out The Light
entries: The Umbral Skullbearer can detect any healing spells being cast within 300 feet of it If a healing spell is r cast on a turn in that radius, the Umbral Skullbearer gains advantage on attack rolls against the caster for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Umbral Skullbearer makes two melee attacks: two with its claw and one with its Soul Tear. It can use Skull Throw in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 11} or be {@condition frightened} of the Umbral Skullbearer for 1 minute, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn.

action.name: Skull Throw
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. On a hit the Umbral Skullbearer teleports in a space adjacent to the target within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Soul Tear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw {@dc 11} or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and have their hit point maximum reduced by that amount. Creatures that are {@condition frightened} of the Umbral Skullbearer have disadvantage on the save. If this effect reduces a creature's hit point maximum to 0, the creature dies. This reduction to a creature's hit point maximum lasts until the creature finishes a long rest or until it is affected by a spell like greater restoration. A creature killed by this ability cannot be resurrected until the Umbral Skullbearer who ate the soul is slain.

action.name: Circle Of Hell
entries: Flames come pouring down from the skulls on the Umbral Skullbearer's back. All creatures within a 40ft radius of the Umbral Skullbearer but not within 10ft of it, must succeed on a dexterity saving throw {@dc 11} or take {@damage 5d6} fire damage, or half as much on a success.

I heard a scream, I rushed forward, I saw her. The love of my life, unconscious in between the jaws of the creature. Blood dripping to the floor, life had left her. The rest of my group laid dead behind me, we never should have said yes to that mission. Despair took me. I fell to my knees, weak. The unholy creature started walking towards me. Soon my suffering would be over.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Those creatures are quadrupedal, long claws at the end of their limbs, rot seeming to infiltrate every pore of their body. This very rot took away their sight, but it enhanced their other senses. Skullbearers lurk in the darkness, and feast on the poor souls that cross their path.

entries.name: Prison of Souls
entries: The skulls they have on their back reflect each soul they have ingested As long as a skullbearer is alive none of the souls it has eaten can move on to the afterlife. No one know where they come from, but the best theory that's being thrown around is that they are the creation of devils wishing to harvest souls to fuel their endless armies.

entries.name: Unseen Light
entries: There are two types of Skullbearers, Gleaming and UmbraL , Umbral ones have their candles extinguished whereas Gleaming ones should shine bright. But a strange phenomenon affects them, they do not emit light, even though all laws of physics indicate that they should This mystery still puzzles wizards to this day.
One thing is sure, if you ever cross a Skullbearer with lights on, run.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Limited  Telepathy
entries: The  Gleaming  Skullbearer  can  magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 ft. of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the Gleaming Skullbearer is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gleaming Skullbearer makes two melee attacks: two with its claw and one with its Soul Tear. It can use Skull Throw in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 14} or be {@condition frightened} of the Gleaming Skullbearer for 1 minute, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn.

action.name: Skull Throw
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/90 ft., one target {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Soul Tear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw {@dc 14} or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage and have their hit point maximum reduced by that amount Creatures that are {@condition frightened} of the Gleaming Skullbearer have disadvantage on the save. If this effect reduces a creature's hit point maximum to 0, the creature dies. This reduction to a creature's hit point maximum lasts until the creature finishes a long rest or until it is affected by a spell like greater restoration. A creature killed by this ability cannot be resurrected until the Gleaming Skullbearer who ate the soul is slain.

monster.name: Teddy's Bear
languages: Common: understands but has trouble speaking

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The teddy's bear can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Immutable  Form
entries: The  teddy's  bear  is  immune  to  any  spell  or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The  teddy's  bear  makes  two  attacks:  one  with  its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 6 ({@damage 1d12}) psychic damage, as the screams of the child resonate in the target's head.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the teddy's bear's choice that is within 120 feet of the teddy's bear and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the teddy's bear's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
{@note Ed...ward}

Teddy's bear is a chimera, created by forbidden transmutation magic. Trying to create a combination between life forms, a desperate scientist sacrificed her own child, without remorse, to engineer this creature.

entries.name: Death and rebirth
entries: Teddy's bear was created by murdering an innocent child, holding on to his most beloved doll, by the hands of someone he trusted The shattered soul is then transferred into a sleeping beast, commonly a bear, and an iron necklace is tied around the new formed creature, to prevent the separation.

entries.name: Behavior
entries: Teddy's bears are usually good, the trapped soul of the child hardly realising what happened to it, and they still follow the command of their murderer. After all, it is a loved one they do not want to let down.

entries.name: Cursed Existence
entries: This abomination of nature lives a life of constant pain and agony, the soul never truly fitting in the body, always feeling like shards are piercing it. This creation grants those monstrosities vision in the afterlife, into the horrors that a child should never put his eyes on. Perhaps one day a kind soul will put an end to their cruel existence.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The grimdancer has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The grimdancer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the grimdancer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the grimdancer knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The grimdancer ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grimdancer makes three attacks, two with its Slash and one with its Bite

action.name: Leaping Strike (Once per short or long rest)
entries: After falling under half its maximum HP, The grimdancer can leap towards up to 3 creatures within 60ft of it. It makes two Slash attack against each target. It leaps back and forth between each target, not triggering attacks of opportunity.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 14} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 10; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save and be paralysed until the end of the grimdancer's next turn, or half as much damage on a successful one and not be paralysed. After succeeding on this saving throw a creature is immune to the paralysis effect from the grimdancer for 24h.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage and 6 ({@damage 1d12}) necrotic damage.
Most monsters are more frightening when they skitter unseen in the dark. Most.

entries.name: Ambushers
entries: Grimdancers are creatures that lurk deep inside cave systems, feasting on any creature that dare venture in their territory. The lay webs which they use to sense their prey, before jumping on them, the kill is swift. It is said that elder grimdancers can even merge with shadows and vanish.

entries.name: Poisoned Treasure
entries: The legs of a Grimdancer are sharp blades, coated with a unique poison that corrodes the skin at a touch. Their fangs contain a potent paralysing poison. Despite their formidable strength, adventurers still venture to challenge them. Indeed the blade on their legs can be forged into unique and powerful weapons. This holds truer for Elder Grimdancers.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elder grimdancer's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The  elder  grimdancer  has  advantage  on  attack  rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The elder grimdancer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight the elder grimdancer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the elder grimdancer knows  the exact location of any  other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web  Walker
entries: The  elder  grimdancer  ignores  movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Shadow  Stealth
entries: While  in  dim  light  or  darkness,  the  elder grimdancer can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder grimdancer makes three attacks, two with its Slash and one with its Bite

action.name: Leaping Strike (Once per short or long rest)
entries: After falling under half its maximum HP, The elder grimdancer can leap towards up to 3 creatures within 60ft of it. It makes two Slash attack against each target. It leaps back and forth between each target, not triggering attacks of opportunity.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 15; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save and be paralysed until the end of the elder grimdancer's next turn, or half as much damage on a successful one and not be paralysed. After succeeding on this saving throw a creature is immune to the paralysis effect from the elder grimdancer for 24h.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.
Most monsters are more frightening when they skitter unseen in the dark. Most.

entries.name: Ambushers
entries: Grimdancers are creatures that lurk deep inside cave systems, feasting on any creature that dare venture in their territory. The lay webs which they use to sense their prey, before jumping on them, the kill is swift. It is said that elder grimdancers can even merge with shadows and vanish.

entries.name: Poisoned Treasure
entries: The legs of a Grimdancer are sharp blades, coated with a unique poison that corrodes the skin at a touch. Their fangs contain a potent paralysing poison. Despite their formidable strength, adventurers still venture to challenge them. Indeed the blade on their legs can be forged into unique and powerful weapons. This holds truer for Elder Grimdancers.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The flying pig doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The flying pig has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Honk
entries: The flying pig screams in distress and fear, all creatures in a 30ft radius around him must succeed on a {@dc 9} Wisdom Saving Throw, or take pity and refuse to attack the flying pig for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the flying pig's Honk for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bonk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

A scream in the night, birds taking flight, beasts are on the hunt tonight. A warrior falls, yelling to his companion to escape before it's too late. The wolves are inching ever closer, their fangs layed bare, saliva dripping, tonight will be a feast. The flying pig comes swinging out of the woods, distracting the pack leader. The warrior doesn't miss the opportunity, his blades swings, ahead falls, the pack flees. "Good job buddy" says the fighter, petting his companion.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Said to be brothers of Pegasus, as can be expected, the Flying Pig is a pig with wings. These vary in species; some have wings like a bird, while others have wings like a bat. Some might even possess wings like various species of insect (if they are of a fey breed). The species of wing does not interchange between breed of Flying Pig. Bird winged pigs of a pure line do not give birth to a bat-winged pig, nor does a bat-winged pig of a pure line give birth to a bird-winged pig.

entries.name: Behavior
entries: Flying pigs behave in a fairly normal porcine fashion, spending much time rooting for food or soaking in mud The eat the same types of food that pig eat-truffles, slop and the like. When faced with danger, however, they take to the sky. After mating, this avoidance of the ground only intensifies; they will make homes in high weight-bearing trees, rocky cliffs and the like, to make nests safe enough to rear young.

entries.name: Faithful and Clumsy Companions
entries: Despite their survival instinct if they ever bond with a human, they will rather sacrifice their life than see their master hurt. Such faithful companions. Another oddity of the flying pig is that they don't seem to realize their size. More than once, a specimen has been known to get stuck in a tree trunk, their little legs stuck, thinking that they could fly through.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the skirja moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Multiattack
entries: The cow makes two gore attacks.

trait.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

In the dark, a crying elven woman falls unconscious in the tundra snow. The winds are howling, the frost is cold enough to shatter bones, death is on the move tonight. Yet, a delicate ray of of sun wakes the woman, she survived the night. Lying against her is a skirja, huddle up against her to share his warmth, long and deep breaths animate his abdomen. It's a peaceful moment. The woman rises, the skirja does the ame, the, elf could swear the beast just smiled.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Cow-like in appearence, they are much bigger and sturdier. A long, thick and fluffy fur isolates their body from the frozen tundras where they herald from. White with a few brown or dark spots, they are difficult to spot in their environment. Underneath all that fur is an impressively strong body, and one would be very ill-advised to stand in front of a stampede of them, if the two sets of horns wasn't warning enough.

entries.name: Docile companions
entries: Many farmers consider those beasts their most prized possesions. Indeed there fur makes for some of the warmest clothing one could ask for, and their »milk is a sweet delicacy in the harsh north. Although they are docile and helpful, they will only bound to people they deem worthy, not letting anyone else touch them. Once bond, Skirjas communicate their emotions telepathically. Because of this trait, farmers who manage to raise them are considered to be extremely trust-worthy.

entries.name: Till death do us part
entries: Skirjas bind to a single companion for a lifetime, it is a well known fact that if one loses their partner, they will fall into a deep depression, stop eating and drinking, until they pass away too.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Jormungandr fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Jormungandr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Titan
entries: Jormungandr deals triple damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Primordial Will
entries: Jormungandr is immune to spells that would teleport him against his will (banishment, plane shift,...) as well as spells that would alter his form.

trait.name: Herald of Ragnarok
entries: Jormungandr reduces the damage taken from any attacks by a number equal to his CR. (Ignore this ability if the attack targets a weak point).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jormungandr can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite, two with its slam. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Terrifying Presence
entries: Each creature of Jormungandr's choice within 3 miles of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 hour. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if Jormungandr is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Jormungandr's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 100 ft., one target. Hit 38 ({@damage 4d12 + 12}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Jormungandr can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: Jormungandr makes one bite attack against a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Jormungandr, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Jormungandr's turns.

If Jormungandr takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of Jormungandr. If Jormungandr dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 110 ft., one target. Hit 30 ({@damage 4d8 + 12}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. If the target creature is on Jormungandr's body this attack automatically hits.

action.name: Thrash
entries: All creatures within 100ft of Jormungandr, or directly on his body must succeed a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 5d10 + 12} damage and be knocked off of his body and {@condition prone}. A successful save means that is only takes half the damage and suffer no other conditions.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Jormungandr makes one Bite or Slam attack Chomp (Costs 2 Actions). Jormungandr makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

legendary.name: Thrash (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Jormungandr uses its Thrash.

items: 1st phase: penetrate the shell.
2nd phase: cut the spinal cord.
3rd phase: destroy the head of the snake.

entries.name: 1st Phase
entries: Jormungandr is busy destroying cities. The heroes can approach him. Once anyone is within 10ft of Jormungandr that gets on the body of Jormungandr, that person will be detected if it rolls a Stealth check below Jormungandr passive perception. If this happens Jormungandr will use his thrash action and legendary action in a row.

Once within 1 Oft of the body, a person can attempt an Investigation (Intelligence) check DC 17 to see if the scales are hiding a weak point. On a success, roll a D4, on a 4 it means the area investigated is in fact a weak point that heroes can attack, ignoring the Herald of Ragnarok ability.

The investigation check covers 20ft squared of his body. The weak points are all on the ground level There is one weak spot every 100ft (this is determined after your players find the first weak spot), and they each have 75HP.

As soon as one is hit, Jormungandr uses his legendary action thrash. Afterwards a character that wasn't hit or succeeded the save can make a Perception (Wisdom) check DC 18 to find the weak spot again as the body shifted.

entries.name: 2nd Phase
entries: When the 3rd weak point is destroyed Jormungandr will bring his head in the position in 2 turns, allowing him to use all his abilities. He will stay within 100ft of the adventurers and moving away as appropriate to keep them at bay from his head.

The scales on his back will also weaken, exposing his spine, a character can try to get on his back and attack him there, it is considered a weak point, it's 5ft wide and as long V as his body. It has 200 hit points. His body is 90 feet tall.
Once it reaches 0 Hit Points, the body of Jormungandr is paralysed (not the condition), and his movement speed becomes 0 as the rest of his body is too heavy to move forward.

entries.name: 3rd Phase
entries: The eyes and and forehead are considered weak points (See* appendix A), even if a creature is on Jormungandr's head the bite and slam attacks can still target them. They have 413 HP, and if they fall to OHP Jormungandr dies. Each eye has 100 HP (counted in the 413HP), destroying one gives him a permanent disadvantage on perception checks, destroying both inflicts a permanent blinded condition.

Characters with no climbing speed must attempt a DC 18 Athletics (Strength) check to climb Jormungandr at a rate equal to their walking speed On a 13 or higher they can climb up at half movement. A check resulting in less than 10 results in a fall.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: fenrir can innately cast earthquake, firestorm and cone of cold (spell save {@dc 24}), once per day each, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Fenrir fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: fenrir has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the fenrir's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: fenrir has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: fenrir's attacks are magical.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: fenrir has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Alpha
entries: All wolves and wolf-kin within a 1 mile radius of Fenrir are considered {@condition charmed} by him.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fenrir can use its Frightful Presence or Ravenous Hunger. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Fenrir's choice that is within 120 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Fenrir's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Ravenous Hunger
entries: Each creature within 300ft of Fenrir must succeed on Strength saving throw {@dc 24}, or be pulled 60ft closer to Fenrir's jaw. If a creature within 60ft fails this saving throw it is then devoured. While devoured, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Fenrir, and it takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage at the start of each of Fenrir's turns. If Fenrir takes 45 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, Fenrir must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all devoured creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of Fenrir.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Fenrir exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Frost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: fenrir exhales frost in a 90-feet cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw, taking 81 ({@damage 18d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Fenrir makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Bite Attack
entries: Fenrir makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Ice pillar
entries: Fenrir stomps the ground making a spire of ice appear. Choose a creature beyond 60ft from Fenrir but within 500ft of him that Fenrir can see. It must make a Dexterity saving throw {@dc 24} or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage. On a success it takes half that damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Destructive Roll (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Fenrir trashes his body around. All creatures within 15 feet of him must make a Strength saving throw {@dc 24}, taking 65 ({@damage 10d12}) bludgeoning damage on a failure, and are knocked {@condition prone}. Fenrir can then move up to half his speed, without triggering attacks of opportunity.

spell.name: Defibrillation
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a target, it takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage. If you touch a living creature that has 0 hit points, the creature succeeds one death saving throw.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. The spell's damage increases by ldl0 when you reach 5th Level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Verglas
entries: You make ice appear at the feet of a creature, it must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th Level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Burning Frost
entries: You release an explosion of fire and ice. Creatures in a 15ft radius around you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} cold damage and {@damage 2d6} fire damage and have disadvantage on their next attack roll.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} of either fire or cold for every spell slot level above 1st

spell.name: Detonating Shard
entries: Make a Melee spell attack roll, on a hit you implant a shard of ice in the body of the enemy creature. You can then detonate the shard using a bonus action on subsequent turns. It deals {@damage 2d8} cold damage if detonated on the next turn. It deals {@dice 3d8} on the turn after, and increases by l{@damage d8} cold damage per turn waited, to a maximum of {@dice 6d8}. If you lose concentration the spell doesn't deal any damage.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radiant damage or the cold damage increases by l{@dice d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Unstable Frost
entries: You cast a ray of frost aimed at a target within 60ft of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit the target takes ldlO cold damage and must succeed a Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} by tendrils of ice until the end of your next turn. If you cast this spell at a target already {@condition grappled} by this spell and hit, it is considered a critical hit and the ice restraining the target shatters, freeing them.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the cold damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Unstable Lightning
entries: Make a ranged spell attack roll, you deal {@damage 2d8} lightning damage on a hit, and if there is another creature within 10ft, make another attack roll, on a hit the spell jumps to the new target, this effect repeats, no matter if the creature is allied or enemy. This spell cannot hit a target twice with a single casting. If there are multiple target that the spell can jump to, the DM randomly determines on which target it will go next.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Roaring Retaliation

time.condition: which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 10 feet of you that you can see

entries: You release a thunderous explosion that is audible within - 300 feet of you. All creatures within 10 feet of you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} thunder damage on a failure, and half as much on a success.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When yout cast this spell using a spell slot 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every spell slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Thunder-Fists
entries: You imbue your fists with thunderous energy, they now count as natural weapons that deal {@damage 1d10} thunder damage on a hit. Every time you strike a creature with those weapons, you can choose to push it back 5ft if it is no more than 1 size larger than you.

spell.name: Forked Lightning
entries: You create two arcs of lightning that streak towards two different targets. Make a ranged attack roll for each arc. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage. If both targets are hit, another arc of lightning forms in between them, they each take an extra {@dice 1d8} of lightning damage.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage of the each primary arc increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Ice Glide

components.m: An ice cube fallen during hail

entries: You make ice appear underneath your feet as you walk. As part of casting this spell, and on subsequent turns as bonus action, you gain a flying speed of 30ft and your walking speed doubles until the end of your turn, and you can walk on water as if it were a solid surface. When the spell ends, you fall if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 10 minutes. For 1 hour using a 4th level spell slot, and 8 hours with a 5th level one. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher you don't need to concentrate on the spell anymore and it lasts 8 hours.

spell.name: Lightning Spear
entries: A spear of storm appears in your hands, it has all the properties of a normal spear but deals {@damage 2d8} lightning damage on a hit, and comes back to your hand after every throw. In addition if you hit a target twice with this spear in a turn, it becomes polarised. While polarised in this way the next 2 attack rolls made with metallic weapons, or dealing lightning damage, against the target have advantage, thanks to the attraction of the electricity.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Storm Aura

components.m: 5 rain drops, collected in a particularly violent storm

entries: You touch a creature, and they begin crackling with stormy energy. They gain resistance to your choice of lightning, thunder or cold damage. In addition, once per turn they can add {@damage 1d4} thunder damage to one melee weapon attack. Finally when a creature within 10 ft of them hits them with an attack, the lightning streaks towards the attackers, dealing ldl2 lightning damage to it.

spell.name: Storm Javelin
entries: You hurl a lightning shaped like a javelin. Make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature that you can see within range. On a hit the targets takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage. In addition whether the target is hit or not, all creatures within 10 ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} lightning damage as the javelin discharges.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When yout cast this spell using a spell slots of 3rd level or higher, the damage of the discharge increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot levels above the 2nd

spell.name: Thunderous Stride
entries: Thunderclouds appear underneath your feet as you walk. As part of casting this spell, and on subsequent turns as bonus action, you gain a flying speed of 40ft and your spells deal an additionnal {@damage 1d4} thunder damage. When the spell ends, you fall if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 10 minutes. For 1 hour using a 4th level spell slot, and 8 hours with a 5th level one. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher you don't need to concentrate on the spell anymore and it lasts 8 hours.

spell.name: Black Ice Wave
entries: You gather black ice and project it forward All enemies in a 30ft line, 10ft wide must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage and {@damage 3d6} cold damage and take the necrotic damage again at the start of their next turn. A creature takes half as much damage on a success, and doesn't take the necrotic damage a second time.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd

spell.name: Frozen Harvest
entries: A scythe of ice appears on a point within range, When you cast the spell, the scythe attacks, all creatures in a 10ft radius centered on the scythe must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} cold damage
As a Bonus Action on Your Turn, you can move the scythe up to 30 feet and repeat the {@action Attack}.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by ldlO for every two slot levels above the 2nd

spell.name: Frozen Smoke
entries: You release a cloud of smoke in a point within range. It fills a 20ft radius, and creates a heavily obscured area. The person casting the spell can see through that area. In addition creatures in the smoke is assaulted by needles of ice and takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground The smoke, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land even pouring down openings.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd

spell.name: Iceberg Throw
entries: You summon a block of ice that flies through the air at breakneck speed towards a target. Make a ranged spell attack roll On a hit the target takes {@damage 2d10} cold damage and 2d 10 bludgeoning damage, and all creatures within a 15ft cone behind the target must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d4} cold damage on a failure, as the block shatters in pieces.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the additional cold damage by {@dice 2d4} for every spell slot level above 3rd

spell.name: Instant Igloo
entries: You create an igloo of dimension 20ft by 20ft that can cover up to 8 people. While inside the igloo you are immune to the effect of the environment and have total cover. Igloo has 12 AC, 80HP, vulnerability to fire and bludgeoning damage, immunity to psychic and poison damage. While inside the igloo you cannot see the outside world and vice versa. A creature of size medium or smaller can crawl 5 ft to enter or exit the igloo, the exit can be blocked.

spell.name: Overcharge

components.m: A piece of copper wire that you crush

entries: Touch one willing ally within range, you infuse them with electric energy. While the spell is active, the target can use a bonus action on each of its turn to teleport up to 15ft, it has resistance against lightning and thunder damage. In addition when a creature damages them, they can use their reaction to make a weapon attack against that creature.
Right after the spell ends, the target takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn, as the electricity escapes their body.

spell.name: Ice Geyser
entries: Ice bursts out of you with divine fury, threatening to destroy you. A cylinder of radiant ice of 15ft radius and 100ft tall appears centered on you. All creatures in this area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} cold damage and {@damage 3d8} radiant damage, or half as much on a failure. You automatically succeed this save.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radiant damage or the cold damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Reverberating Jump
entries: You teleport to a point that you can see within 120 feet. This creates a line of thunderous energy between your point of origin and arrival All creatures within 10 feet of that line must makes a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} thunder damage and be pushed back 10ft. They take half as much damage on a success, and are not be pushed back. The thunder can be heard from up to 300 feet away.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d8} and the length that you can teleport increases by 10ft for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Stalagmite

components.m: A shard of everlasting ice worth 500g

entries: Spikes of ice emerge from the ground in a point within range. All creatures within a 15ft radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature that fails the save takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and is Restrained as the ice stalagmites impale it. On a success it takes half as much damage and isn't Restrained. A Restrained creature can repeat the save at the start of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success, or taking an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage on a failure.
entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius increases by 5ft for every spell slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Thorn Impalement
entries: Thorns grow viciously on your body, creating spikes that cover you. Tentacules of vines sprout from your back, forcing all other creatures in a 15 feet radius centered on you to succeed a Strength saving throw or be pulled 15ft closer to you and be impaled on the thorns and take {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage and {@damage 2d8} piercing damage. If two small or larger creatures occupy the same square after the spell is casted, they fall {@condition prone}.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the piercing damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Vision of the Storm

m.text: Incense burnt worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: If there is a storm directly above you (no obstruction), you can focus and merge your mind with it temporarily. You see all the area that the storm covers from the point of view of the clouds, anything not covered by the clouds is {@condition invisible} to you.
While doing so you are blind in regard to your own senses While merged with the storm your are considered deaf, the rumbling of thunder being too loud.

spell.name: Winter's Pack
entries: Two ephemeral wolves made of hail and wind appear at your feet. You can order them to attack a creature within 30ft of you with a bonus action, they use your spell casting modifier to calculate the attack roll, and each make one attack against the same target that deals {@damage 1d10} + your spellcasting modifier cold damage, and then come back at your feet. As a reaction to taking damage, you can sacrifice one of the wolf that will take the damage in your stead They can each only take one hit before disappearing, and they diminish the damage taken by a maximum of 20 points.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot 5th level of or higher, the number of wolf you control increases by 1 for every two slot levels above the 4th.

spell.name: Ice Block

time.condition: that you take when you take damage that should reduce you to 0 hp or lower, but not kill you outright.

entries: You encase yourself in ice, you gain immunity to all damage, including the triggering damage, the ice covering you. While in the ice you are immune to all damage, but are {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated} The ice melts at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Storm Hammer

components.m: a small hammer made of metal

entries: You point your finger at an area on the ground that you can see within 120ft of you. A colossal hammer of lightning crashes down from the heavens on that location. All creatures within a 30 feet radius of the point of impact must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} lightning damage and {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a success.
The area affected by the spell becomes scorched and unstable, it becomes difficult terrain for the next month. This spell deals double damage to objects and structures.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every spell slot levels above the 5th.

spell.name: Dominion of Winter
entries: An area of 1 mile centered on you becomes affected by winter. Snow starts to pour and the temperature drops below 0°C. This effect lasts for 24h. While this area spells that deal cold damage deal an additional 4 points of cold damage. Spells that deal fire damage deal 4 less. If this spell is cast everyday for a year, the effects become permanent.

spell.name: Glacial Fissure
entries: You ram your fist into the earth, all creatures in a 10ft wide and 90 foot long line in front of you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} as debilitating frost covers them. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns.

spell.name: Investiture of Storm
entries: Until the spell ends, a thunderstorm wraps around you, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a flying speed of 40 feet, as lightning lifts you. If you are still flying when the spell ends, you fall if nothing is holding you aloft.
Storm clouds envelop your body until the spell ends, causing you to become heavily obscured to others.

You can use your action to summon lightning. You create a 10-foot radius sphere of electricity centred on a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature in that area must succeed a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 4d8} lightning on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Storm Stride
entries: You gain the ability to teleport into a storm and reappear on the ground directly under another within 20 miles or another place under the same storm. You must be directly under a storm without any obstructions. You instantly know the area covered by the storm you're teleporting in, and if there are any other storms in the radius. You can choose to bring up to 8 willing creatures with you, they must all be touching you.

spell.name: Storm Unleashed
entries: You fill the world around with a destructive storm, aiming to annihilate everything in your path. At the end of each of your turns, all creatures of your choice in a 20ft radius around you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be struck by righteous lightning and take {@damage 6d8} lightning damage, or half as much on a success. Creatures carrying metal weapons or armour have disadvantage on the saving throw.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: White Dragon Embodiment
entries: Wings of ice sprout on your back giving you a 60ft flying speed and you gain immunity to cold damage. In addition you can use an action every turn to exhale a frost breath in 30ft cone, a creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} cold damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.

spell.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: You attempt to electrocute an enemy. Make a melee spell attack roll, on a hit you deal {@damage 8d8 + 20} lightning damage and the target is paralysed until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Spirit of the Storm

m.text: lightning captured in a bottle made of dragon scales worth at least 5000 gp

entries: You call forth the Spirit of the Storm. The spirit manifests physically in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The creature physically resembles a dragon, made out of thunder clouds with lightning coursing through it. This corporeal from uses the {@creature Adult Blue Dragon} stat block. It cannot use Legendary Actions, and gains immunity to thunder damage. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions for the spell's duration. In combat the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys mental commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it defends itself but otherwise takes no action.

feat.name: Last Dying Breath
entries: Your physique allows you a few moments of clarity before unconsciousness, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you take damage that reduces you to 0 hit point or lower, and you are not killed outright, you get an extra turn. During that turn you can only use your action, it has to be the Attack Action (Weapon Attacks only). You then fall unconscious and must immediately roll a death saving throw. Once you used this ability you can't use it again until you've taken a long rest.

feat.name: Ice to meet you
entries: Your presence is cold and intimidating.

items: You have advantage on all intimidation checks, and can use Strength (Intimidation) checks instead of Charisma (Intimidation) Checks.

Once per long rest you can try to make an intimidation check, contested by a creature's Wisdom (Insight) check. If they fail, they are afraid of you for 1 minute and their speed become 0. They can use an action on subsequent turns to repeat their check, ending the effect on a success.

feat.name: Frost Acclimation
entries: Your body has gotten used to the harsh cold, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to cold damage
You ignore difficult terrain caused by the cold

feat.name: Jötunn Magic
entries: You awaken your primordial blood, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell faerie fire} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the divination or evocation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, this spell is also added to your spell list. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Frost Breath
entries: Your Dragon breath has been altered by the north, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your dragon breath now can inflict cold damage in a 15 foot cone in front of you, instead of your regular dragon breath damage.

When you use your dragon breath a creature takes 2d6 damage + your Proficiency bonus on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 5th level, 4d6 at 8th level, 5d6 at 11th level, and 6d6 at 17th level.
You can use your dragon breath twice between rest.

feat.name: Cleaving Attacks
entries: Your attacks carry weight and devastate the battlefield, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength against a creature, if there are other targets within 5 feet of you and it, you can cleave them with the same attack. You target other creatures within reach and, if the original attack roll can hit them, apply damage equal to your Strength modifier.

feat.name: Wrestler
entries: You know how to utilise your body as a weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you succeed on a Shove Attack you can push the creature a number of feet equal to 5 times your Strength Modifier.
You can move at full movement when you grapple a creature of same size or smaller than you.
When you attempt to grapple, you can make a special grapple instead where you take a -5 penalty to your check, but if you succeed the target is grappled and restrained.

feat.name: Nimble
entries: You can leap from place to place, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
You can use Dexterity instead of Strength to calculate jumping distances and if you use Strength, your jumping distance is doubled.

feat.name: Defender
entries: You learn to protect your allies from the tides of battle, you gain the following benefits:

items: When an ally you can see within 5 feet of you is the target of a creature's attack roll, you can use your reaction to leap in between your ally and the enemy as long as you are not prone, grappled, or restrained You move up to 5 feet into your ally's space, and your ally must have an unoccupied space within 5 feet of them that they take during the move. Your ally's movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. This makes you the new target of the triggering attack roll.

feat.name: Looping Cantrips
entries: You've learned to increase the potency of your cantrips, you gain the following benefits.

items: When you cast a cantrip, instead of increasing that damage when you reach certain levels, you can cast the cantrip additional times as part of the same action. The cantrip must deal damage, and it must make a spell attack or require a saving throw. You can cast it two times at 5th level, three times at 11th levefand fourtimes at 17th level When you do, the cantrip can deal its damage more than once, but its other effects aren't applied to the same target again.

feat.name: Reckless Casting
entries: You can unleash the hidden wealth of power within yourself, treatening to destroy everything, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you cast a sorcerer spell you can spend one hit dice. If you do, the expended spell slot counts as a spell slot of one level higher (to a maximum of 9th), and you take 1d6 necrotic damage. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

legendaryGroup.name: Jörmungandr
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Jormungandr takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Jormungandr can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

•   A tremor shakes the continent in a 120-foot radius around Jormungandr Each creature other than Jormungandr on the ground in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. An {@creature Earth Elemental} with 10 HP appears next to each creature that fell prone.

•   A boulder from a nearby mountain crashes down in a 30 feet radius in an area 300 feet from Jormungandr. All creatures in that radius must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 7d8} bludgeoning damage.
•   Clouds of poison surround Jormungandr, all creatures within 60 feet of him must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute and take {@dice 3d6} poison damage.
regionalEffects: Once Jormungandr is awake and lets go of his tail, he changes the environment by creating the following effects:
•   Earthquakes of different magnitudes start erupting everywhere on the continent.

•   A constant tempest rocks the oceans and covers the continent. The rain is tainted by Jormungandr, a creature that starts its turn in the rain unprotected takes 1 point of poison damage and 1 point of acid damage.

•   The oceans that hold Jormungandr have suffered its poison. A creature that touches the water for the first time, or that starts its turn in the water takes {@dice 1d4} poison damage and {@dice 1d4} acid damage.
If Jormungandr dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} hours.

entries.name: Imposing Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity, for the creatures you can grapple and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Giant's Might
entries: Awakening your blood, you can cast the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} spell on yourself once per long rest, using only the spell's enlarge option.
Þurs are massive and powerful Known to accomplish impressive feats of strength, they are usually frontliners in their army. Others might prefere a more peaceful life.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your skin is closer to a hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have darkvision to a range of 60ft.
Val-dyr have inherited from their ancestors their keen and beastly senses. Fantastic hunters, they are hard to pin down. They are most fierce when night falls and their prey sleeps.

entries.name: Innate Magic
entries: You know the control water cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the spell Faerie fire once. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the Maximilian Earthen grasp spell once. You must finish a long rest to cast these spells again with this trait. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
In addition if you possess the spellcasting or pact magic class feature, those spells are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.
Ginnungagap have inherited ancestral magic. In tune with the elements they are often druids who scour the land in search of remedies, or in search of wisdom to counsel chieftains.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your maw is full of fangs that can be used as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Feeding Frenzy
entries: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious hunger. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points (minimum of 1) equal to your Constitution modifier + your level and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.
Grádr are said to be in a constant state of hunger. Although this is but a myth, the way they battle reflects this. They use their jaws and fangs to feed off their prey and regain power.
